chargeHist.descr: Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald L. Musselman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).
  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls @ 9:02 a.m. State has received copy of PSI report, no additions or corrections. Def has received copy of PSI report, does have some corrections. Court notes that case number is listed as Marathon Co case but is Langlade Co case. Atty Debord makes corrections for the record to items on pages 9, 11, and 12. Statement by Atty Debord regarding blood draw. J.K. gives statement. D.M. gives statement. Exhibits 1-5 offered by the State. Sentencing arguments by the State. Ex 4 copy of statement of B.K. Ex 5 copy of statement of J.D. Ex 1  photo of victims' vehicle. Ex 2 photo of driver's side of vehicle. Ex 3 photo of victim. State recommends 8 yrs prison, 5 yrs initial confinement, 3 yrs extended supervision, asks Court to follow recommendation in report as to conditions of ext. supv. Arguments by Atty Debord. Ex 6 - 3 pgs from medical reports, marked and offered. Recommends withheld sentence, 8 yrs probation, 1 yr jail as condition. 8 days credit on any sentence. Asks Court to not exceed recommendation in report. Statement by Defendant. Recess @ 9:38 for Court to review items received today. Resume 9:45. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Orders on ct 1 - 5 yrs prison, 3 yrs initial confinement, 2  yrs extended supervision, court costs, credit for 8 days time served, DNA sample and surcharge, no contact w/victims or family members unless approved by Dept, restitution $1,000.00 to victim, maintain absolute sobriety, counseling as recommended by DOC. Def is eligible for earned release program. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Apply bond to restitution. Ct 3 - same sentence, 5 yrs prison, 3 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, concurrent, court costs and same conditions. Cts 4 & 6 same sentence, 5 yrs prison, 3 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, court costs. DNA surcharge is only on ct 1. All counts concurrent. Postconviction rights. Def is remanded to custody of sheriff. (Exhibits 1 - 6 received.)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Bond Receipt
Bail Bond

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in court via video with attorney Brent Harold Debord appearing by telephone.  Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in custody.  Jill Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:39 a.m. Court reviews status. State gives bond arguments. Statement by the Court. Response by Atty Debord. Def has nothing to add. Remarks by the Court. Warrant vacated.

Attorney Brent Harold Debord in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke, Marathon Co DA, Asst appeared for the State of Wisconsin appointed for Special Prosecutor.   Court calls  @ 9:50 am.  Court appoints Mr. Uttke as special prosecutor.  Atty DeBord gives update on defendant. State request Body Warrant and gives reason.  Court authorize warrant, Body only, statewide.  Asst DA Laufenberg can handle the case.

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF8, 1TR1097, 14TR1096  @ 1:04pm.  Atty Debord will represent def. on traffic citations. 14TR1096 & 14TR1097, No contest plea to both citations, Court will receive pleas & finds def. Guilty to both citation, fine on 187.90 on 14TR1096 & 14TR1097 Fine of $200.50.  Def. given pp. Court adjourns on both citation & moves on to 15CF8 Court has copy of letter dated 8-19-15 from DA. Atty DeBord & def. agree with letter. Plea questionnaire & waiver of atty rights filed.  Def. understands charges & penalties. Ct's 1 Causing Injury, no contest, 3-2nd degree, no contest, 4-injury by Intoxicated use of vehicle, no contest & 6-2nd degree reckless injury, no contest, Ct's 2 & 5 DRI. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Both sides would be free to argue sentence.  PSI will be ordered.  Atty DeBord is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given, accept pleas.  State gives facts on case BAC. .095, however drawn after 5 pm & accident around 2 pm. Defense finds enough factual basis. Court finds factual basis, accept pleas & finds def. Guilty to ct 1 Injury be Intoxicated, Ct 3 2nd Degree Reckless, Ct 4 Injury by Intoxicated use of vehicle & Ct 6 2nd degree Reckless Injury. Court orders Pre-Sentence Report. Court will amend information to read on victim name to RJK. Court will amend information to read RJK. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:00 p.m. Copy of information received, reading waived, not guilty pleas. Court accepts not guilty pleas to all cts. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

# 1 - Photos of accident scene that day
# 2 - Statement of J.D.
# 3 - Photo of vehicle
# 4 - Wisconsin State Patrol Analysis & Reconstruction Report
# 5 - Toxicology Report

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CF8, 14TR1096 & 14TR1097 @  2:52 pm.  State is ready to proceed. Darrel Eldridge, Deputy for Langlade County Sheriff Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies. Exh #1 Photo's of accident on the day. Exh #1 offered, Exh #2 Written statement from J.D.  Exh #2 offered, Exh's #1 & 2 received. Exh #3 - Photo of vehicles,Exh. # 3 offered & received Exh #4 - Wisconsin State Patrol Analysis. Exh #4 - offered, Exh  #4 received. Exh #5 - Results from State Crime Lab, offered & received. J.K., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  State rest.  State is not going to file an information at this time & will be adding a counts of, Reckless Causing Injury & Great Bodily Harm to Mr. K. When information filed will serve Atty Debord.  Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
for Discovery - Defendant's

Atty Bayne-Allison has been discharge from def.  Def. is firing Atty Bayne-Allison.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Special appearance by Atty Schuster.  Complaint received, waive reading.  Time limit for preliminary waived.    Request bond to be continued.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman in court, in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:05 p.m. State gives background and bond recommendations. Def explains why didn't appear. Def advised to contact Public Defender's Office. Def given copy of complaint. Court vacates warrant. 14TR1096 and 14TR1097 to follow.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No use of alcohol.  No operating a motor vehicle.

Defendant Ronald L. Musselman not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF8 @ 9:17 am. Court now calls  14TR1096 & 14TR1097. State request warrant, Court grants warrant body only
